stanza.line: When I do count the clock that tells the (a)time(/a)
And see the brave day sunk in hideous (b)night(/b)
When I behold the violet past (a)prime(/a)
And sable curls all silvered o'er with (b)white(/b)
When lofty trees I see barren of (c)leaves(/c)
Which erst from heat did canopy the (d)herd(/d)
And summer's green all girded up in (c)sheaves(/c)
Borne on the bier with white and bristly (d)beard(/d)
Then of thy beauty do I question (e)make(/e)
That thou among the wastes of time must (f)go(/f)
Since sweets and beauties do themselves (e)forsake(/e)
And die as fast as they see others (f)grow(/f)
And nothing 'gainst Time's scythe can make (g)defence(/g)
Save breed to brave him when he takes thee (g)hence(/g)
